meanings.definition: A short nap taken in the early afternoon, especially in hot countries.
meanings.sent1: In Spain, many people enjoy taking siestas after lunch.
meanings.sent2: During the siesta, the town becomes quiet as everyone rests.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a siesta sounds like a dream come true on a busy day.
meanings.sent4: Her siestas were like little pockets of peace in the midst of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The image of a siesta under a shady tree is so relaxing.

meanings.definition: A period of rest or sleep taken in the early afternoon.
meanings.sent1: After a hearty meal, a siesta can help recharge your energy.
meanings.sent2: The workers in the field often take a siesta to escape the midday heat.
meanings.sent3: Taking a siesta feels like hitting the pause button on a hectic day.
meanings.sent4: During her siestas, she dreams of faraway lands and adventures.
meanings.sent5: The siesta is like a mini-vacation in the middle of the day.
